verses.text_plain: And Job answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1And Job answered and said,

verses.text_plain: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
verses.verse_html: 2No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

verses.text_plain: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
verses.verse_html:
3But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these? ▼
▼ understanding: Heb. an heart
 , ▼
▼ I am…: Heb. I fall not lower than you
 , ▼
▼ who…: Heb. with whom are not such as these?

tokens.text: to you: yea, who knoweth not such things

footnotes.body_html: ▼ understanding: Heb. an heart

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I am…: Heb. I fall not lower than you
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I am…: Heb. I fall not lower than you

footnotes.body_text: ▼ who…: Heb. with whom are not such as these?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ who…: Heb. with whom are not such as these?

verses.text_plain: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.
verses.verse_html: 4I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.

verses.text_plain: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
verses.verse_html: 5He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

tokens.text: of him that is at ease

verses.text_plain: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
verses.verse_html: 6The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.

verses.text_plain: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
verses.verse_html: 7But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

verses.text_plain: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
verses.verse_html: 8Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

verses.text_plain: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord hath wrought this?
verses.verse_html: 9Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord hath wrought this?

tokens.text: not in all these that the hand

verses.text_plain: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
verses.verse_html:
10In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind. ▼
▼ soul: or, life
 , ▼
▼ all…: Heb. all flesh of man

footnotes.body_text: ▼ all…: Heb. all flesh of man
footnotes.body_html: ▼ all…: Heb. all flesh of man

verses.text_plain: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
verses.verse_html:
11Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat? ▼
▼ mouth: Heb. palate

verses.text_plain: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
verses.verse_html: 12With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

verses.text_plain: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
verses.verse_html:
13With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding. ▼
▼ With…: that is, With God

footnotes.body_html: ▼ With…: that is, With God

verses.text_plain: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
verses.verse_html:
14Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening. ▼
▼ up: Heb. upon

tokens.text: and it cannot be built again
and there can be no opening

verses.text_plain: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
verses.verse_html: 15Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

verses.text_plain: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
verses.verse_html: 16With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.

verses.text_plain: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
verses.verse_html: 17He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

verses.text_plain: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
verses.verse_html: 18He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

verses.text_plain: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
verses.verse_html: 19He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

verses.text_plain: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
verses.verse_html:
20He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged. ▼
▼ speech…: Heb. lip of the faithful

footnotes.body_text: ▼ speech…: Heb. lip of the faithful
footnotes.body_html: ▼ speech…: Heb. lip of the faithful

verses.text_plain: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
verses.verse_html:
21He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty. ▼
▼ weakeneth…: or, looseth the girdle of the strong

footnotes.body_text: ▼ weakeneth…: or, looseth the girdle of the strong
footnotes.body_html: ▼ weakeneth…: or, looseth the girdle of the strong

verses.text_plain: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
verses.verse_html: 22He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

verses.text_plain: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.
verses.verse_html:
23He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again. ▼
▼ straiteneth: Heb. leadeth in

footnotes.body_html: ▼ straiteneth: Heb. leadeth in

verses.text_plain: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
verses.verse_html: 24He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

verses.text_plain: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
verses.verse_html:
25They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man. ▼
▼ stagger: Heb. wander

tokens.text: and he maketh them to stagger
